passage: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes: • Solar energy is a renewable and clean source of power. • Photovoltaic cells, also known as solar cells, are used to convert sunlight into electricity. • Concentrated solar power systems use mirrors to focus sunlight onto a small area, generating heat that can be used to produce electricity. • Solar energy can help reduce greenhouse gas emissions and decrease reliance on fossil fuels.
question: Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to emphasize the environmental benefits of solar energy?

choices.A: Solar cells, also known as photovoltaic cells, are used in solar energy systems.
choices.B: Concentrated solar power systems use mirrors to focus sunlight onto a small area.
choices.C: Solar energy can help decrease reliance on fossil fuels by using sunlight as a power source.
choices.D: Solar energy, a renewable and clean source of power, can reduce greenhouse gas emissions and decrease reliance on fossil fuels.

explanation: D: 'Solar energy, a renewable and clean source of power, can reduce greenhouse gas emissions and decrease reliance on fossil fuels.' is the correct answer because it effectively uses relevant information from the notes to emphasize the environmental benefits of solar energy.
distractor_explanation: 'Solar cells, also known as photovoltaic cells, are used in solar energy systems.' is incorrect because it only provides a definition of solar cells and does not emphasize the environmental benefits of solar energy.

'Concentrated solar power systems use mirrors to focus sunlight onto a small area.' is incorrect because it only describes a specific solar power system and does not emphasize the environmental benefits of solar energy.

'Solar energy can help decrease reliance on fossil fuels by using sunlight as a power source.' is incorrect because it only mentions one environmental benefit of solar energy but does not mention its ability to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
